doc.field: Robert Thorney and Jemima Frost Craft marriage certificate
Robert Thorney and Jemima Frost Craft marriage certificate

Marriage certificate of Robert Thorney Craft and Jemima Frost of Queens County, signed by Cadwallader Colden, Lieutenant Governor and Commander in Chief of the Province of New York under King George III. The certificate is dated 1764. Robert Thorney Craft was a joiner by trade.

Marriage certificate of Robert Thorney Craft and Jemima Frost of Queens County, signed by Cadwallader Colden, Lieutenant Governor and Commander in Chief of the Province of New York under King George III. The certificate is dated 1764. Robert Thorney Craft was a joiner by trade.

Marriage certificate of Robert Thorney Craft and Jemima Frost of Queens County, signed by Cadwallader Colden, Lieutenant Governor and Commander in Chief of the Province of New York under King George III. The certificate is dated 1764.
Robert Thorney Craft was a joiner by trade. He married Jemima Frost in 1764.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.
